ratings.comment: Belinda is a really good professor. Very smart and really knows what she is talking about. Fin 420 has one exam and then a pitch book for your final. You can expect to pull atleast one all nighter for the pitch book. Its a lot of work but really good class, I learned a lot and really liked her as a professor.

Available for answering questions after class, but not very clear during the lectures. She doesn't teach that much, but merely gives a large amount of homework so that we learn through practice. Solutions (almost) never available though. WSJ quizzes don't always make sense.

I have to say she is an excellent professor as she organizes lectures pretty well and exams are fair. If you are a finance or accounting person, you will be able to manage to get an AB with efforts. However, she seems like she never checks her email during vacation. Never replied my email for questions about final grade until the deadline.

If you're taking fin300 you should just know going in that the course is tough. Getting an A requires some serious dedication (and maybe even some luck), but if you study hard then you'll definitely get a B or better. That said, Belinda's pretty great. She makes fin300 as enjoyable as fin300 can be. Cool lady.

Engaging and charismatic professor. Begins with current events discussion, works through examples during lecture. Homework is time-consuming and unrelated to exams. Discussion helpful for practice problems. Exams are very long and difficult, but extremely fair. Excellent professor.

Does not understand that everyone in the class is not a finance or accounting major and the material is difficult to understand when she puts up a random problem and tells you to solve it however you want. Goes through lectures fast, not taking the time to explain things. Exams completely unrelated to hw & quizzes that would take 20 hrs each week.
She was very passionate about what she does, however a lot of the material on homework and exams was not covered in either the book or class.  Very frustrating

Super Nice! Talks a lot about current events.. interesting and it will be on the exams!  Use the old exams to study, sign up for the BLC and don't waste your time in discussion. Just study hard and you'll be fine.
Do yourself a favor.  Take another professor for this course.  Exams are ridiculously difficult and unrelated to the homework.

Spends 15 or so minutes teaching vocab and finance topics through a discussion of current events, then spends the rest of class solving problems. She is very charismatic and fun to listen to, she makes the power lecture tolerable. Tests are long, hard and fair. Class is well organized and clear. Great professor, my favorite class of the semester.

One of the best class I have taken in my university life. Although the exam may be a bit difficult, it is a fair game. If you study and do your own homework, you will be able to do it. The project is very useful and REAL! I highly recommend the class for everyone interested in being an investment banker or is interested in the field.

Exams are very difficult (50-60% averages). The class moves too fast; all knowledge will be lost shortly after because not enough time is given to retain the information. Find the best strategy to master the MyFinanceLab hw/tests in order to help your grade.

she assumed that the students remembered everything from acct100 which was not the case. makes exams way too hard, even though she gives out past exams to review. most midterm avg was a 65, if that tells you anything, however the class is curved but still overly difficult.
The best class ever.

If you're a math person this class shouldn't be too difficult.  Study hard for the first exam, the equations and concepts for the first exam are the basis for the remainder of the course.  If you do that, the remainder of the class shouldn't be too bad.  The exams are challenging, but if you study past exams you should do well.

Belinda is very interesting and she brings current events into her lectures which is nice, however she does test you on these current events.  The tests and homework are challenging but everything is curved so it works out in the end.  I'd recommend taking this class with Belinda.

I don't see why everyone complains about Belinda, she's great! Lecture is entertaining and helpful, and she allows cheat sheets on the exams!! I studied a few hours for each exam and got an A in the class. She's a fantastic professor, really knew her stuff and how to explain it all students. Attending lecture is a must but you'll be rewarded.

If you are going to be a Finance major you should take this class with Mucklow. She makes the midterms tough so you really have to know your stuff. Lectures are very interesting and if you go over the passed exams she posts you should have no problem getting a B.

To start, this is the last semester professor Mucklow is teaching FIN 300. Her class was difficult, but if you take the BLC class it is manageable. Her lectures were very interesting. She starts every class with important things about your current day life, gives some good life advice throughout the semseter, and engages the class in participation.

I highly recommend this class. I learned a lot and she makes finance fun to learn about. BEWARE her tests are unreal difficult. But as long as you know that going into the class, just put in the time and you will be fine. If you're an econ student, it's almost as hard as econ 301, so if you did fine in that, you will survive this one

Mucklow is an interesting lady, but has impossible exams. Truly tests your understanding by giving you easy examples and tests you on small things with little quirks you didn't realize you had to go over.

Belinda is great at teaching and makes lectures interesting, but her exams are really tough. She tries to trick you and really tests your knowledge. Homework is very time consuming and nothing like the exams. Past exams are very helpful and she lets you use a cheat sheet, so you can put all the formulas on there which is very nice.
This class really peaked my interest in Finance and Investing. The professor definitely did not underestimate our intelligence! Also included a lot of current event info.
Lectures are clear and usually interesting.  The BLC is more helpful than discussion, and the old exams are more helpful than the homework.
Nice work

Good personality, bad lecturer. Formulas aren't derived and you're basically expected to plug and chug on a financial calculator. She'll discuss timely business news in class which is interesting, but I left this class without much else. Not as hard as people say, though, just variations of simple basic concepts.

This class was extremely time consuming. The online homework was unrelated to test questions and it was also hard to compare many of the examples in class to exam questions. Make sure to focus your studying on old exams and give yourself enough time to do the homework well.

Although plentiful of past year exams is available, they only keep you busy by presenting concepts that are not covered in class. Basically she expects you to know everything and therefore the lecture goes so fast until you cant comprehensive anything. 25hours of studying before each of the three midterms is common. But that does not mean an A.

To get an A in this class you only need to study her old tests and pay attention to the current events issues she discusses. Skip the discussion and sign up at the BLC. The tutors teach to the test and classes are tiny so you can get all your questions answered.

Keeps the class interesting.  I hate finance and she didn't even derive the formulas; most of them she just presented and we were expected to plug in numbers. Plus she wanted us to use these 'financial calculators' which meant you didn't even have to remember the formula! She also won't accept differing points of view.

Mucklow would assign 6 hours of homework the week before the exam, and a typical week was about 2-4 hours of homework. The homework had nothing to do with the exams. The book was useless. The tests are very hard... she aims for the average to be around 70. The exams go beyond what you learn in lecture.

She tries to make the class interesting, but overall it's pretty challenging. It's easy to feel like you have all the material down, but then still get a 70 on the tests. They are curved a lot- a 75 is usually an AB-ish. Book/homework problems aren't really representative of the tests.
Love her class. It's the first class in the university that I find particularly interesting. Not very hard to get an A as long as you are smart.

Personally, I thought she was very overrated - although somewhat hot, shes very arrogant and really not all that helpful - I really don't see whats all that great about her - seems that other SoB professors are much, much, much better - also, exams are curved like mad, with most people falling in the 60's - too bad no one else teaches the class...

She may be english and have a hot accent, but dont let that fool you.  Her class is actually sort of interesting and fun to go to and her homework and online tests arent that bad.  When it comes to actual exams, EXTREMELY DIFFICULT!!! She taught MBA at Chicago and her exams reflect that!  Exams are unlike anything you will see prior to the exam.
She's AWFUL!!!!

she moves through material too fast to comprehend anything. tests are really hard and the class extremely competitive so it will take up a lot of your time. use her old tests to study. finance is easy but she is rediculously difficult.
She is really fun and know what she is talking about but the subject itself is just hard. The tests are very hard. Discussion is not mandatory but very helpful for examples.

She is a great lecturer, having received her PH.D from Cornell Johnson, but she has Ivy League arrogance.  She acts like office hours are a waste of time.  On top of that, the exam averages were around 63%, and to get an A, you need to break 85%.  Go figure.  I studied my ass off (15 hours for each exam) in this class and got an AB.  Apathetic!
Exams were pretty tough. Average scores were 6o%s, but there's a massive curve. She's hot though, so that's a plus.
Tests are very difficult, but she posts practice exams that are almost identical.  She goes through the material very fast, but she is an awesome teacher.  Makes class a lot of fun.

Whoever said this is right...extremely easy to get a B, but hard to get an A.  She does an excellent job of making a pretty dry subject fun and interesting.  She does cover a lot of material very fast, and you may have to do a lot of work and reading on your own to grasp it thoroughly.  Exams long and difficult, & discussion is useless, as stated.

Mucklow is quite sexy for a professor. Her stories at the beginning of lecture are entertaining and insightful.  She moves fast through material so be ready to do alot of work outside the class to grasp the material.  The old tests and practice problems are very similar to the midterms so study them. Discussion section is useless.

She's very funny and interesting. I found it hard to follow her in lecture because she'd move very quickly and jump around. Her tests are VERY hard!! overall she's a good professor, but you need to put the work in.

Belinda is a great teacher. She trys to keeps class really interesting and works in other topics outside of finance to mix it up a little, the first 15 mintues are usually about what is going on in the news and other random facts/stories.  The exams are tough, but if you study the old exams and do the homework you should be okay. do not get behind!
The material is fairly easy to grasp as long as you know arithmetic and some algebra.  The exams are very similar to the old ones, so if you study the ones she gives out, you will do fine.

I thought the prof was generally  good and explained concepts well, but I am a finance major and find the material interesting. The exams are very close to the practice exams but she seems to have one exam every year that is different. If you can do the homework problems and practice exams you should be fine. Only grades are exams. Final is 50 MC.
Mucklow's accent and teaching style suck. I hated her class. The exams were hard as hell but the curve helps you out. I got an AB but I worked my ass off. Be ready to spend your weekends studying.
Materials are boring, so is the lecturer. Sometimes she spends time on easy problems and skims through the difficult concepts. There are unrelated questions in her exams.

She isnt a bad professor.  Boring at times, but mostly pretty entertaining.  However, class can be pretty pointless.  Discussions are a waste of time.   You can pretty much teach yourself everything.  Her tests hold very closely to her past her exams.
She's okay... Lectures are boring at times. Not a very helpful professor. Better read the notes and text book.

She's charming^^ and she's clear in lecture, although the accent is a little wired coz she's British. Her exams are neither easy or hard, but if you study hard you'll have good achievements. btw, she allows cheatsheet on both sides of a A4 paper!!!

Tough class to get an A in, really easy to get a B in.  For a core business requirement, you really can't complain.  Belinda is smart, funny, and engaging and although lectures can be pretty boring you don't really have to attend all of them.  Definitely know the prior exams well because a lot of the questions are very similar or even the same.

The class was not that difficult. She has an entertaining personality, tests for the most part are exactly the same as the previous semester with a few ridiculous questions that are essentially irrelevant towards the material. anyway, it was a core bus. class, and they always are pretty lame, but this was probably my favorite one.

Lecture only good for examples.  Reading the book was the best way to understand the material.  Definitely recommend typing out the cheat sheets so you can read them during the test and re-print for the final.

I disliked the course and found it boring, probably as I am not a Finance major. Belinda, though, is a pretty good lecturer. Shes interesting, oddly funny, and very likable, but I guess lecture is still boring in the end due to the content. Tests are pretty tough but the curve helps... she also allows for a page worth of cheat sheets per exam.
tough class, hard exams, lectures online, read the book
Aweful professor. Accounting class taught as a finance/valuation class. Did not lecture, responsible for everything, unknown expectations, worst professor in collegiate career.

I love Belinda. Sometimes too smart for her own good, but still one of the best professors I've had the pleasure of being taught by. Tests are difficult but she engages in her lectures and makes most of the material interesting enough to actual care about studying.
Lecture is not bad. She is funny and the class goes by rather quickly for a power lecture. Tests are pretty challenging. Bindy really knows this stuff (she teaches MBAs!).

Great professor!  She is great at engaging students during lecture.  Test were mostly based off lectures so the reading the text chapters wasn't necessary.  I definitely recommend this class and professor to anyone.

She is freaking annoying.  The only things she tests on that are not in the book are only worth about 5 points on the exam.  They usually have to do with websites and general stuff like selling short.
I really enjoy her...a lot!

Very good professor. She explains things very well. Her tests are fair but hard because she can put anything in it that she discussed in class(which could also be a little topic). She has that personality that engages you in the stuff that she is talking about. Definately take this class with her!!!
